required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessement of a Novel Approach to Ultrasound-guided Brachial Plexus Blockade
clinical_study.official_title: Assessement of a Novel Approach to Ultrasound-guided Brachial Plexus Blockade, Located Between the Infraclavicular and the Axillary Site

brief_summary.textblock: Assessement of a new approach of an ultrasound guided brachial plexus blockade between the infraclavicular and axillary area.

detailed_description.textblock: After an assessement of this new approach of ultrasounded-guided brachial plexus blockade in cadavers, the aim of this human study was to asssess the validity of this method in humans. The probe will be disposed on the shoulder, and the brachial plexus will be seeked below the deltoid, lateral to the major pectoralis muscle and in the vicinity of the brachial artery. At this area, an ultrasounded guided needle was inserted with an in-plane direction towards the brachial artery and local anesthetics was disposed all around the artery, without puncturing the differents nerves. Regional blockade will be evaluated by measuring onset and duation time for sensitive and motor blockade, effectiveness of this blockade, patient's confort during the procedure, ease of the procedure for practitionner, quality of ultrasound image's interpretation before and after injection.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of block realisation assessed by number of abandonned block
primary_outcome.description: Difficulty in the block realisation (block abandonned before or during realisation)

primary_outcome.measure: Efficience of the block assessed by number of block sufficient for surgery
primary_outcome.description: Is the block enough for surgery or must be completed

primary_outcome.measure: Comfort during block realization assessed by EVA
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of comfort during block realization

secondary_outcome.description: Impression of the difficulty for the operator to perform the block
Neuropathy or other secondary effect post block during 7 days

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparative image axillary and novel point of puncture
secondary_outcome.description: Number of halo separating artery from different nerves at this novel level and at the axillary level

arm_group.description: Descriptive study about the effectiveness and the feasability of this new approach of te ultrasound guided brachial plexus blockade

intervention.description: Ultrasound probe disposed on the shoulder, on the deltoid muscle. in plane puncture toward the brachial artery and injection of local anaesthetics around the brachial artery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Arm surgery performed under axillary blockade
Exclusion Criteria:
- Local anesthetics allergy
- Coagulation disorder
- History of chronic pain
- Drug or alcohol abuse
